title: Menu
description: The Menu component provides a flexible dropdown menu with support for both standard and autocomplete functionality. It allows users to toggle visibility, select items, and filter results dynamically.

body.raw:
# Menu Component The `Menu` component provides a dropdown menu with options for standard and autocomplete menus. ## Preview and Code Snippet Preview Code {(() => { const { useState } = React; const [search, setSearch] = useState(""); const menuItems = [ { label: "Home", icon: "üè†" }, { label: "Settings", icon: "‚öôÔ∏è" }, { label: "Profile", icon: "üë§" }, { label: "Logout", icon: "üö™" }, ]; const filteredItems = menuItems.filter((item) => item.label.toLowerCase().includes(search.toLowerCase()) ); return (
Menu üè† Home ‚öôÔ∏è Settings Search Menu setSearch(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border-b border-gray-300 dark:border-gray-600 focus:outline-none" /> {filteredItems.map((item) => ( {item.icon} {item.label} ))}
); })()} ```tsx import { useState } from 'react'; import { Menu, MenuTrigger, PopMenu, MenuItem } from '@/components/menu'; export default function Example() { const [search, setSearch] = useState(''); const menuItems = [ { label: 'Home', icon: 'üè†' }, { label: 'Settings', icon: '‚öôÔ∏è' }, { label: 'Profile', icon: 'üë§' }, { label: 'Logout', icon: 'üö™' }, ]; const filteredItems = menuItems.filter((item) => item.label.toLowerCase().includes(search.toLowerCase()) ); return (
Menu üè† {' '} Home ‚öôÔ∏è {' '} Settings Search Menu setSearch(e.target.value)} className="w-full p-2 border-b border-gray-300 dark:border-gray-600 focus:outline-none" /> {filteredItems.map((item) => ( {item.icon} {' '} {item.label} ))}
); } ``` ## Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | | ----------- | ------------------------- | ------- | --------------------------------------- | | `className` | `string` | `''` | Additional CSS classes. | | `open` | `boolean` | `false` | Controls the visibility of the menu. | | `setOpen` | `(open: boolean) => void` | `-` | Function to toggle the menu state. | | `children` | `ReactNode` | `-` | The content inside the menu components. | ## Usage Steps 1. Import the `Menu`, `MenuTrigger`, `PopMenu`, and `MenuItem` components. 2. Wrap the menu items inside the `Menu` component. 3. Use `MenuTrigger` to create a clickable button for toggling the menu. 4. Wrap menu items inside `PopMenu` for display. 5. Optionally, include an input field inside `PopMenu` to create an autocomplete menu. ### Example ```tsx Options ‚öôÔ∏è {' '} Settings üö™ {' '} Logout ```
